org.sindice.siren.util

Class CodecUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sindice.siren.util.CodecUtils

  • public class CodecUtils
extends Object
    Contains methods to encode an integer into a byte array and decode a byte array into an integer.

      • byteArrayToInt

        public static int byteArrayToInt(byte[] src,
                 int offset)
        Convert a byte array to an int (32bit word).
        Parameters:
        src - The byte array (length = 4)
        offset - The offset of the encoded integer in the byte array
        Returns:
        The integer

      • intToByteArray

        public static final void intToByteArray(int x,
                  byte[] dst,
                  int offset)
        Convert an integer to a byte array.
        Parameters:
        x - The integer
        dst - The byte array (length = 4)
        offset - The offset of the encoded integer in the byte array

      • vIntToByteArray

        public static void vIntToByteArray(int i,
                   ByteBuffer bb)
        Writes an integer in a variable-length format. Writes between one and five bytes. Smaller values take fewer bytes. Negative numbers are not supported.
        See Also:
        DataInput.readVInt()

      • byteArrayToVInt

        public static int byteArrayToVInt(org.apache.lucene.util.BytesRef ref)
        Reads an int stored in variable-length format. Reads between one and five bytes. Smaller values take fewer bytes. Negative numbers are not supported.

      • appendVInt

        public static void appendVInt(int i,
              org.apache.lucene.util.BytesRef ref)
        Writes an integer in a variable-length format. Writes between one and five bytes. Smaller values take fewer bytes. Negative numbers are not supported.
        See Also:
        DataInput.readVInt()

      • writeBytes

        public static void writeBytes(byte[] array)
        Display the content, i.e. bits, of a byte array. Write to stdout the content of the array on a single line.
        Code taken from Lucene-1410.
        Parameters:
        array - The byte array

      • writeIndentBytes

        public static void writeIndentBytes(byte[] array)
        Display the content, i.e. bits, of a byte array. Write to stdout 4 bytes per lines.
        Code taken from Lucene-1410.
        Parameters:
        array - The byte array
